item.title: Comment on How to read Window Dimensions in Blazor? by Mo
item.dc:creator: Mo
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sumit Khaitan.

you need to call `StateHasChanged();` to refresh the UI.

protected override async Task OnAfterRenderAsync(bool firstRender)
{
await GetDimensions();
StateHasChanged();
}

item.title: Comment on How to read Window Dimensions in Blazor? by Sumit Khaitan
item.dc:creator: Sumit Khaitan
item.description: Is there a way to get the dimensions before the page is loaded? I have a table to render which should take up the complete width. But using it extends its parent (which in turn extends its parent and so on) beyond the window size. Only solution that works is when I use fix-width for one of its ancestor, so I think it will be better to set the width of the entire page to browser window.
item.content:encoded:
Is there a way to get the dimensions before the page is loaded?
I have a table to render which should take up the complete width. But using it extends its parent (which in turn extends its parent and so on) beyond the window size. Only solution that works is when I use fix-width for one of its ancestor, so I think it will be better to set the width of the entire page to browser window.
